column4: Anyone know how to get the Logitech laser mice (g5, G7) back buttons working?
also, having backspace go back a page in firefox would be nice :(
and the mice? i found a howto, but it was for earlier mice, and it said "you will need to change things for g5", and did not elaborate
I wrote a guide for the mx1000 on the wiki, it should be very similar
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MX1000Mouse  what do you mean by hex code?
you can figure out the button numbers using 'xev'
all you have to do is setup evdev and then use xbindkeys (or something similar) to bind the keys accordingly
I have no idea what the problem is, I just know it "doesn't work"
from a comment you made earlier, i take it you dont think sudo gedit /etc/somefile is a good idea?
oh, yeah, it's not the kind of think you should be doing so often that typing sudo is a burden imo
you seem to be the expert on things here
bruenig told you how, I think you missed it
I think every 10-15 minutes is fine, there are other support options too:
that didn't used to say that...
